instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2879: What is 820-2879? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.C6990: What is C6990? Capacitor to ground on input to PP3V42_G3H power supply. PP3V42_G3H power supply turns 18.5v from charger or 8.5v-12.5v PPBUS_G3H from the battery into PP3V42_G3H. This capacitor can short to ground and keep PP3V42_G3H from turning on which would keep the machine from having a light on the magsafe charger.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B   power on but  just beep every 5 seg,  no chime, video,  green light
threads.message:
[PLAIN][SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B   power on but  just beep every 5 seg,  no chime, video,  green light[/PLAIN]

Hi I got this one today  water damage (cofe juice)who know,  no green light,  check I have short to ground in F7040 fuse out,   apply 12v to short side,  <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> got  hot  remplace,  short gone  green light up, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> up, fan spin  nice and clean and finger lol  the shit turn on but video no crime no nothing  just beep every 5 seg like memory error I check  <CHIP>U7300</CHIP> is no hot able to read 0.75 and 1.5v for memory  check cpu vcore  1.15v  mpc vcore 0.89 and I m freezzz lol  any idea  thank you

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B   power on but  just beep every 5 seg,  no chime, video,  green light
threads.message: Measure resistance to ground on L6995 and diode mode red probe to ground and black probe on each pin from Y2815.....  Report values....

threads.message:
red probe to ground  .320           black probe to ground .770       both side  l9695

pin1 .847
pin2  open
pin3 .783
pin4  open
y2815    red probe to ground

threads.message:
Where is resistance to ground??

[QUOTE="aprendiz, post: 7298"]

1.- Measure [COLOR=#FF0000]resistance[/COLOR] to ground on L6995
2.- Diode mode, red probe to ground and black probe on each pin from [COLOR=#FF0000]Y2815[/COLOR].....

Report values....[/QUOTE]

Does it beep without memory???

one beep every 5 seg until shut down  or manual turn off,  I changed the <CAPACITOR>C6990</CAPACITOR> because look funny after that  turn on  the screen one time  no crime  after that same beep  again

I check the <CHIP>U6990</CHIP> and got 

pin1   1.26v
pin2  3.40v
pin3   7.06
pin4    3.42
pin5 gnd
pin6 18.73
pin7 nc
pin8  18.73
